Detailed Description

A POINT encapsulating class.

This class is similar to the Windows POINT structure. It also includes methods to manipulate CPoint and POINT structures.

A CPoint object can be used wherever a POINT structure is used. The operators of this class that interact with a size accept either CSize objects or SIZE structures, since the two are interchangeable.

This class is derived from the tagPOINT structure. (The name tagPOINT is a less commonly used name for the POINT structure.) This means that the data members of the POINT structure, x and y, are accessible data members of CPoint.

Definition at line 107 of file atlmisc.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

WTL::CPoint::CPoint (    )  [inline]
 

Constructor.

This constructor creates an instance of a CPoint object. If no parameters are given, x and y members are not initialized.

Constructor.

Parameters:
dwPoint  Sets the x member to the low-order word of dwPoint and the y member to the high-order word of dwPoint.

void WTL::CPoint::operator+= (  POINT    point )  [inline]
 

Offsets CPoint by adding a size or point.

This operator adds the x(or cx) member of the right operand to the x member of the CPoint object and the y (or cy) member of the right operand to the y member of the CPoint object.

Parameters:
point  Contains a POINT structure or CPoint object.

CRect WTL::CPoint::operator- (  const RECT *    lpRect )  const [inline]
 

Returns the difference of a CPoint and a size.

This operator subtracts a CPoint or CSize object from CPoint.

Parameters:
lpRect  Contains a pointer to a RECT structure or CRect object.
Returns:
A CSize that is the difference between two points, a CPoint that is offset by the negation of a size, a CRect that is offset by the negation of a point, or a CPoint that is the negation of a point.

void WTL::CPoint::operator-= (  POINT    point )  [inline]
 

Offsets CPoint by subtracting a size or point.

This operator subtracts the x, or cx, member of the right operand from the x member of the CPoint and the y, or cy, member of the right operand from the y member of the CPoint.

Parameters:
point  Contains a POINT structure or CPoint object.
